definitions.definition: A being involved in the action of a story.
A distinguishing feature; characteristic; trait; phene.
definitions.example: A single locus governing the petal colour character was detected on the linkage group A2.

definitions.definition: A complex of traits marking a person, group, breed, or type.
definitions.example: A study of the suspect's character and his cast iron alibi ruled him out.

definitions.definition: Strength of mind; resolution; independence; individuality; moral strength.
definitions.example: "You may not like to eat liver," said Calvin's father, "but it builds character."

definitions.definition: A unique or extraordinary individual; a person characterized by peculiar or notable traits, especially charisma.
definitions.example: Julius Caesar is a great historical character.

definitions.definition: A written or printed symbol, or letter.
Style of writing or printing; handwriting; the particular form of letters used by a person or people.
definitions.example: an inscription in the Runic character

definitions.definition: A secret cipher; a way of writing in code.
One of the basic elements making up a text file or string: a code representing a printing character or a control character.
A person or individual, especially one who is unknown or raises suspicions.
definitions.example: That old guy is a real character.

definitions.definition: A complex number representing an element of a finite Abelian group.
Quality, position, rank, or capacity; quality or conduct with respect to a certain office or duty.
definitions.example: in his character as a magistrate

definitions.definition: The estimate, individual or general, put upon a person or thing; reputation.
definitions.example: Her actions give her a bad character.

definitions.definition: A reference given to a servant, attesting to his/her behaviour, competence, etc.
